lines.text: A genius acquires widows of many kinds.
So like him, yet so unlike...
So like him, yet so unlike...
So like him, yet so unlike...
So like him, yet so unlike...
So like him, yet so unlike...
How unlike him, yet dead like! What a silly thing to say!
The Master disappeared with his wife. Discretion a point of honor.
My name is Adelaide.
And mine Cornelius.
I - am Felix's wife.
I'm Bumble Bee. Am I in the biography?
Bumble Bee?
Bumble Bee, his mistress. Of course!
But... just now the Master... a lady... who was not his wife.
That wasn't his official mistress. Because that's me! You're quite a doll. Shall I show you his bedroom?
That'd be interesting. But isn't he... ?
Silly! Not in his bedroom! Come! Come, come! Come, come, come, come, come, come, come!
I sit admiring his hands. I go funny all over when I watch that hand twiddling the strings. And in a trice I'm sitting where the cello was.
It's not possible.
He has such wonderful fingering. Isn't that what it's called?
He calls me his gamba, his little lap viol.
The things I do for art!
to open your legs." He's course! There he sleeps in his shameless nudity.
I know a way you can see Felix.
At last we understand each other.
Felix has a little weakness.
Women.
Don't you see? Why not dress you up as a woman?
You're crazy!
The whole house is crazy. You must be adaptable. Never mind your virile looks. His appetite is insatiable. I'll give him your picture and say you've been pining to meet him.
I shall kill you!
In that dress?
The rudiments of cello playing - to open your legs!
[laughing]

[Enters]
What's the joke? Do tell me.
It's wasted on a pianist!
oblivion!
The Fish's Dream or Abstraction No. 14.

[Last lines]
That's the end of the film.
